REPORT OF NAEB ENGINEERING
COMMITTEE MEETING
Washington D.C. May 23-24, 1055
Present: B rugger * Holmberg, Ketcham, Kratt, Menzer.
Absent: Higgy.
Also present were Mr. C.S. Bidlack, NAEB Engineer and Mr. C0M. Braum,
JCET Engineer.
The NAEB Engineering Committee met in the Ambassador Hotel, Washington, D.C.,
during the morning and evening of May 23 and during the morning and afternoon of
May 24. The afternoon of May 23 was spent inspecting new equipment shown by
manufacturers at the NARTB equipment show. A separate report covering new
equipment is being, submitted. Topics discussed were as follows:
A. Report of new equipment.
Bo 1955 NAEB Engineering Workshop.
C. FM multiplex and how it may be ©f use to NAEB.
Do Improvements in NAEB tape network.
E. Need for FM daytime test period.
F. Proposed FCC regulations re harmonic and spurious radiation.
G. Progress of attempt to get professional recognition and advancement, and
discussion of lack of personnel v wage scales, job classifications, wage
equalization, etc.
H. Fuads for visits of TV engineers to other operating stations.
L Study of NAETB Engineering Committee and future exchanges with this
committee.
J. Pool of test equipment.
K. NAEB network - FM, AM, Line, Microwave, FM Multiplex.
L. Standards for video recording.
M. Attendance of engineers at NAEB convention - meetings.
N. Technical reports and contributions to NAEB Newsletter.
O. Use of Roster of technical personnel.
Q. BHF problems.
A brief report of the discussions, progress and recommendations covering the
above list follows:
A. Report of new equipment: The Committee spent the afternoon of May 23
inspecting new equipment shown by manufacturers at the NARTB equipment show.
A report covering such new equipment in being submitted separately. In view of the
fact that a similar report was submitted two years ago, only newly introduced
equipment is covered and an attempt made to show how it may be ©f value to
NAEB members.
B. 1955 NAEB Engineering Workshop: A report was made by Mr. Bidlack on
progress to date. The program structure as well as applications were discussed.
Program details were decided and a complete outline is available from Mr. Bidlack.
It was thought that more applications from qualified individuals would be received
before June 1. If however, this was not the case, it was suggested that the deadline
for applications bo extended until July 1 and efforts made to urge candidates to
apply. It is hoped that a more qualified list of registrants might thereby be
available for assignment.
